page.title: 12Hutton Poplars
page.content: Along the Rayleigh Road stands Bishop Hill Adult Education Centre and behind this some land known as Hutton Poplars which residents of Hutton have been fighting for since 1975. The land now 48 acres once belonged to the Children's Home which was owned and managed by the London Borough of Hackney.Much of the original farm land was sold over 30 years ago and has become the housing estate of Long Ridings.After the school closed down an article appeared in the local paper saying that Hackney would build 288 houses and garages on the spare land.Hutton people didn't agree and a campaign was mounted to stop the land being developed and to use it as a park instead.The land already looks like a park but walkways,play areas for children,bowling greens and tennis courts would be added.
